name: Snort
notes: Only the ability actually called *Snort* will teach the spell; it is cast quite late into The Dragon's Neck.

name: Acorn Bomb
notes: Largely irrelevant due to the Sleep role action.

name: Bristle
notes: Buffs *spells*, not *abilities*. Spells are *usually* tied to the GCD, while abilities are not (usually Primal spells).

name: Mind Blast
notes: Guaranteed learn even when running unsynced.

name: 1000 Needles
notes: Always deals exactly 1,000 damage unless the enemy is invulnerable.

name: the Look
notes: Largely irrelevant due to Mighty Guard threat modifier.

name: Loom
notes: Loom is easiest to learn from Flame Sergeant Dalvag. Using Loom is not faster than just running normally.

name: Glower
notes: Guaranteed learn even when running unsynced.

name: Missile
notes: Has approximately 67% accuracy.

name: Toad Oil
notes: Largely irrelevant due to most bosses having 100% accuracy.

name: Off-guard
notes: Stacks with Peculiar Light.

name: Tail Screw
notes: Has approximately 10% accuracy.

name: Level 5 Petrify
location: Manor Sentry (*before* the first boss) / Haukke Manor

name: Moon Flute
notes: Yes, it is worth using even with the Waning Nocturne debuff. The damage we gain during Moon Flute outweighs the handful of Sonic Booms we would miss during Waning Nocturne.

name: Doom
notes: Has approximately 33% accuracy.

name: Peculiar Light
notes: Stacks with Off-guard.

name: Diamondback
location: Cuca Fera (vulnerable to Death effects) / The Stone Vigil (Hard)

name: Eruption
notes: Can trivially be learned solo synced on normal difficulty with 1000 Needles.

name: Veil of the Whorl
notes: This is inferior to Glass Dance.

name: Protean Wave
notes: Can be learned from the tornadoes during Act 2 of Red, Fraught, and Blue (Stage 29).

name: Chirp
notes: Largely irrelevant due to the Sleep role action.

name: Gobskin
location: Alexandrian Hider / Alexander - The Breath of the Creator

name: Frog Legs
notes: This is not a proper provoke; it has a very small range and only sets your enmity to 1 more than the current highest enmity.

name: Whistle
notes: Buffs *spells*, not *abilities*. Spells are *usually* tied to the GCD, while abilities are not (usually Primal spells).

name: Level 5 Death
notes: Has approximately 90% accuracy.

name: Launcher
notes: Has 100% accuracy, but MP cost makes it a bad choice.

name: Cactguard
notes: Largely irrelevant due since it can only be cast on other players.

name: Condensed Libra
notes: Largely irrelevant with level 70 spells since we don't have the slots for three filler spells.

name: Aetheric Mimicry
notes: Can easily be learned solo. Unsynced is fine here, since we just keep killing adds on the first boss until it's learned.

name: Cold Fog
notes: In order to learn the spell you must *fail* the three heads mechanic during Mist Dragon.

name: Saintly Beam
notes: A decent list of vulnerable enemies can be found [here](https://finalfantasy.fandom.com/wiki/Final_Fantasy_XIV_enemies/Ashkin).

name: Choco Meteor
notes: This is our best spell in the overworld (outside of duties), but only does 200 potency inside duties.
